div.l: AT Trōmpyngtoıı̄un not fer frām cāntabregge
Þ̉ere goth a brok ⁊and oủer þᵗat a bregge
Vp on þᵉ which brok þ̉er stant a melle
And this is veray soth þᵗat I ȝᵘou telle
A mellere was þ̉er dwellȳnge many aday
As ony pekok he was proud ⁊and gay
Pype he coude and fyssche and netys beete
And turne cuppis ⁊and wel wrestele ⁊and schete
Ay by hese belte he bar a long panade
And of a swerd ful trenchaunt was the blade
A Ioly poppere bar he in hese pouche
Ther was no man for peryl durste hȳm touche
A sheffeld Thwytel bar he in hese hose
Round was hese face ⁊and kāmmede was hese nose
As pelyd as an ape was hese skolle
He was a markat betere at þᵉ fulle
There durste no wygh hand vp on hȳm leyeye
That he ne swor þᵗat he schulde anon a beyeye
A thef he was for sothe of corn ⁊and mele
And þᵗat a sly ⁊and vsaunt for to stele
And his name was hotyn deynous symkyn
A wif he hadde comyn of noble kyn
The ꝑpersoıı̄un of the toun here fadyr was
Wᵗith here he ȝaf ful many a peny of bras
For þᵗat Symkyn schulde in hese blod alye
Sche was fostered in a nūnnerye
For Sȳmkyn wolde no wyf as he seyde
But sche were wel I noryschid ⁊and a mayde
To sauȳn hese estat of ȝemanrye
And sche was proud ⁊and pert as is a pye
A ful fayr syghte was it on hēm to
On holye dayis be forn here wolde he ge
Wᵗith hese typet boıı̄undyn a boutȳn hese hed
And sche come aftyr in a gite of red
And sȳmkyn hadde hosyn of the same
Ther durste no wygh clepȳn here but dame
